conclusion: Calculate the change in magnetic flux through the coil as it rotates 60° around the z-axis.
Magnetic flux through a surface is given by the formula: Φ = B ⋅ A ⋅ cos(θ).
B is the magnetic induction intensity, A is the area of the coil, θ is the angle between the magnetic field direction and the normal to the surface of the coil.
Initially, the coil is aligned such that its normal is along the x-axis.
The angle θ between the magnetic field and the normal to the coil is 0°.
The initial magnetic flux Φ_i is 0.04 Wb.
The coil rotates 60° downward around the z-axis.
The normal to the coil now makes a 60° angle with the x-axis.
The final magnetic flux Φ_f is 0.02 Wb.
The change in magnetic flux ΔΦ is -0.02 Wb.
The magnetic flux passing through the coil changes by -0.02 Wb.
